lead_paragraph: The podcast has soared in popularity. But there’s not much money in it for Apple, the genre’s creator, leaving many in the community feeling neglected.

headline.main: Podcasts Surge, but Producers Fear Apple Isn’t Listening

snippet: The podcast has soared in popularity. But there’s not much money in it for Apple, the genre’s creator, leaving many in the community feeling neglected.
abstract: Pressure from rapidly expanding podcast industry is forcing Apple to decide whether to change outdated iTunes software and business model created by Steven Jobs in 2005;  producers complain Apple has not kept up with industry's growth and needs to make significant changes regarding promotion, social media and listener demographics; despite popularity, podcasts represent negligible revenue stream for Apple.
